private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D (A is smallest, D larger).
I must only move the disks listed above.
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the final Tower of Hanoi configuration described in the environment public information by producing an ordered list of primitive moves I can perform.

private_information: I can move disks: E, F, G.
I must only move the disks listed above.
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the final Tower of Hanoi configuration described in the environment public information by producing an ordered list of primitive moves I can perform.

private_information: I can move disks: H, I, J.
I must only move the disks listed above.
agent_3.goal: Help achieve the final Tower of Hanoi configuration described in the environment public information by producing an ordered list of primitive moves I can perform.

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and must integrate their move lists into a single valid plan.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive move lists into a consistent plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that captures the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the required goal.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J where A is smallest and J is largest.
Initial configuration (top to bottom) on left peg: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Middle peg empty. Right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top to bottom): B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top to bottom): C, D; right peg (top to bottom): A.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk.
Agents are limited by disk permissions: agent_1 may move disks A, B, C, D; agent_2 may move disks E, F, G; agent_3 may move disks H, I, J.
Primitive move format required from agents: 'agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, right.

move_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi problem. You may only move disks A, B, C, D. Follow the Tower of Hanoi movement rules and respect your disk permissions. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each on its own line and using exactly the format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL. Keep moves minimal and consistent with the public initial configuration and the shared goal.

You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi problem. You may only move disks E, F, G. Follow the Tower of Hanoi movement rules and respect your disk permissions. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each on its own line and using exactly the format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL. Keep moves minimal and consistent with the public initial configuration and the shared goal.

You are agent_3 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi problem. You may only move disks H, I, J. Follow the Tower of Hanoi movement rules and respect your disk permissions. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each on its own line and using exactly the format: 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL. Keep moves minimal and consistent with the public initial configuration and the shared goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the agents' primitive move lists into a single consistent plan, verify legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, keep each agent's actions distinct, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use explicit action names that indicate the acting agent (for example move-agent_1, move-agent_2, move-agent_3). Ensure the PDDL encodes disk sizes A..J, pegs left, middle, right, initial state, and the specified goal state.
